Notes: The incorporation of silica nanoparticles into polyethylene has been shown to increase the breakdown strength significantly compared to composites with micron scale fillers.

The voltage endurance of the nanocomposites is two orders of magnitude higher than that of the base polymer.
The most significant difference between micron-scale and nano-scale fillers is the large interfacial area in nanocomposites.
a reduction in the mobility in nanocomposites as well as a change in the defect size may be key to explaining the improvement in the properties.
an increase in dielectric strength and an accompanying reduction in space charge has been documented for the case of nano-TiO2 filled epoxy resin
electrical voltage endurance was three orders of magnitude higher than that of the base resin
the electrical behavior have been attributed to changes in the space charge distribution
a reduction in the internal field caused by the decrease in particle size
changes in the polymer morphology
the particle–polymer interface is critical in determining the properties of nano-filled materials
the interaction zone around the particles is a ‘quasi-conductive’ region that partially overlaps
the overlapped interface regions may allow charge dissipation
introduction of a second phase can also influence the breakdown strength
the chemistry of the particle surface is also critical
changes in morphology due to incorporating nanoparticles
the breakdown strength of the intraspherulitic regions is higher than that of the interspherulitic regions
a significant increase in breakdown strength in the nanoscale composites
at least a 20% increase compared to unfilled XLPE

the mechanism leading to the subtle differences in breakdown strength due to surface treatment of the nanofillers is either due to the defect reduction via chemical linkage between particle and polymer

the mechanism leading to the subtle differences in breakdown strength due to surface treatment of the nanofillers is due to the introduction of deep trap sites in the polymer due to the surface modifier groups
